dilution_policy_limit_pct_source: eligible to participate in the LTIP ... up to a total amount of 5% of the issued share capital of the Company.
ceo_ltip_max_pct_of_salary_source: The face value of the awards ... was €6m for the CEO ... €540,000 annual base salary paid to each executive director.
post_cessation_holding_years_source: Executive directors will be required to hold shares exceeding 100% of salary ... for two years post-employment.
shareholding_requirement_ceo_source: Minimum share ownership requirements are set at three times executive director base salary.

AUM-weighted gross value creation across private equity strategies

extraction_notes: Financial year is 2024 per multiple references to the year ended 31 December 2024. Currency set to EUR as remuneration amounts are denominated in euros (e.g., €540,000 salary). Dilution policy limit set to 5 based on LTIP limit of up to 5% of issued share capital; no actual dilution figures disclosed, so total/ltip/stip dilution are null. CEO LTIP max % of salary computed as (€6,000,000 face value at full vesting for CEO) / (€540,000 base salary) * 100 = 1111.11%; using explicit figures provided. Post-cessation holding is 2 years and shareholding requirement is 3x salary per explicit policy. No target or maximum short-term bonus percentages disclosed; moreover, no short-term incentive proposed and no 2024 bonus awarded, so bonus % fields are null. CEO/workforce salary increase percentages are not disclosed. Malus and clawback provisions explicitly exist (apply up to two years post vesting/payment). ESG metrics are present in LTIP performance conditions (TSR, financial, and non-financial metrics including SBTi targets and women representation). Being conservative, did not derive any overall dilution from option counts since full issuance scope not provided.
